title: Is reusing college essays for multiple applications okay? - Quora

response.answer_text: Generally, I object to that practice, but ask the professor (in advance). A research project is a self-directed learning experience. In a given field, you should narrow the topic, and probably reduce it to a single question for which you want the answer. Your paper (essay) should offer a reasonably full discussion of the topic you presented—an answer to the research question, a claim that is probably debatable. Your task is usually to persuade readers to consider your position. Outside of English faculty, most teachers are primarily interested in what you have learned in addition to what you have been tested on. Your essay is a window to your brain. Essays are opportunities to practice presenting your perspective on things, and most of us can’t get too much practice with that. If you asked me about one paper for two different courses, I would probably said, “no.”

The word “relatively” in your question bothers me. You can re-use answers when questions are the same. If they are “relatively the same,” your answer probably has to be amended to a certain degree to fit each prompt precisely. Either way, make sure the answer sounds made to order for each particular question
I highly recommend that you do some research on UPenn and change the Cornell Supplement to fit it! It is totally okay. By the way I am applying to Cornell too! Good Luck
You can use the same essay. Just make sure you include ln each version the info each college is asking for.
